intro: Meadia hendersonii var. cruciata, commonly known as the Henderson's meadia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats, often in forest understories where it forms compact, low-growing rosettes. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable and requires careful protection.
